body.p:
Frankfort
To his excellency the Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned states that he is and was a Soldier in theCompany K 55 Ky Mounted Infantry and when the regiment was mustered out he was in Hospital at Covington -- He came here with Lt Phips who stopped here for a few days -- While here he had a pistol in his custody which he had taken to clean & repair and while he had it he was arrested ^& fined in the police Court of Newport^ for carrying a concealed weapon & put in prison & there kept until he replevied the debt being told that was all that he could do to get out of Jail -- He desires to go to Louisville & be mustered out and asks that said fine be remitted -- He was not aware that he was violating any law having said pistol
I know the above Ben Montgomery and that he is a soldier He belonged to the Company I was in as Lieut -- & has not yet been mustered out -- I hope the govenor will remit the fine as asked

J M Ward, Late 1st Lieut
55th Ky Co K

Frankfort City Ct
vs
Ben Montgomery
$50,
Concealed Weapon
7th Dec/65
Remit
